text: The government's decision to explore the strategic sale of Indian Drugs and Pharmaceuticals Ltd. and Bengal Chemicals – even as questions were asked of the move last week by parliamentarians including those from the BJP – shows a lack of imagination by successive governments. The two public sector undertakings (PSUs) were pioneers in laying the foundation for the self-sufficiency in drug production in this country. With such a platform, an almost unlimited supply of money, access to government infrastructure and a helpful regulatory and patent regime, they had all the ingredients for lasting success.
title: Pharma PSUs Are Not Ready To Die!
